What does the `getbestblockhash` command do in Verus?
The `getbestblockhash` command returns the hash of the best (tip) block in the longest block chain.

getbestblockhash

Returns the hash of the best (tip) block in the longest block chain.

Result
"hex"   (string) the block hash hex encoded

Examples
> verus getbestblockhash 
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getbestblockhash", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
What is the format of the result returned by the `getbestblockhash` command?
The result returned by the `getbestblockhash` command is a string representing the block hash in hexadecimal encoding.

getbestblockhash

Returns the hash of the best (tip) block in the longest block chain.

Result
"hex"   (string) the block hash hex encoded

Examples
> verus getbestblockhash 
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getbestblockhash", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
How can I use the `getbestblockhash` command to get the hash of the best block in the longest block chain?

You can use the `getbestblockhash` command in Verus by running the command `verus getbestblockhash` in the command line, or by making an HTTP request using a tool like `curl`, passing the `getbestblockhash` method with no parameters.

getbestblockhash

Returns the hash of the best (tip) block in the longest block chain.

Result
"hex"   (string) the block hash hex encoded

Examples
> verus getbestblockhash 
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getbestblockhash", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
